page.title: 03BRAMFIELD
page.content: Bramfield is a small village about three miles north west of Hertford town center.It has a population of about 300. Bramfield no longer has a village school,it has been made into the village shop and post office.Therefore most children have to go to school by coach.Most children of primary school age go to Stapleford (39%),other primary schools attended are St. Joseph's and Tewin.The secondary schools attended are Sele, Presdales and vrious boarding schools. There is only one shop in Bramfield which is also a post office.Many people (63%) go shopping in Hertford, and Stevenage (22%).Others go to Welwyn and Ware.
